con:interface.name: public_doc

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of the available [domains](documentation/glossary?term=domain) for a given bilingual language dataset.
Lists available domains in a bilingual dataset

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of the available [domains](documentation/glossary?term=domain) for a given monolingual language dataset.
Lists available domains in a monolingual dataset

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to retrieve sentences extracted from corpora which show how a word is used in the language. This is available for English and Spanish. For English, the sentences are linked to the correct sense of the word in the dictionary. In Spanish, they are linked at the headword level.
Retrieve corpus sentences for a given word

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to retrieve definitions, pronunciations, example sentences, grammatical information and word origins. It only works for dictionary headwords, so you may need to use the Lemmatron first if your input is likely to be an inflected form (e.g., 'swimming'). This would return the linked headword (e.g., 'swim') which you can then use in the Entries endpoint. Unless specified using a region filter, the default lookup will be the Oxford Dictionary of English (GB).
Retrieve dictionary information for a given word

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Retrieve words that are opposite in meaning to the input word (antonym).
Retrieve words that mean the opposite

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
USe this filter to restrict the lookup to either our Oxford Dictionary of English (GB) or New Oxford American Dictionary (US).
Specify GB or US dictionary for English entry search

con:parameter.con:name: region
con:parameter.con:description: Region filter parameter. gb = Oxford Dictionary of English. us = New Oxford American Dictionary.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to retrieve words that are similar in meaning to the input word (synonym).
Retrieve words that are similar

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Retrieve available [synonyms](documentation/glossary?term=thesaurus) and [antonyms](documentation/glossary?term=thesaurus) for a given word and language.
Retrieve synonyms and antonyms for a given word

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use filters to limit the entry information that is returned. For example, you may only require definitions and not everything else, or just pronunciations. The full list of filters can be retrieved from the filters Utility endpoint. You can also specify values within the filter using '='. For example 'grammaticalFeatures=singular'. Filters can also be combined using a semicolon.
Apply filters to response

con:parameter.con:name: filters
con:parameter.con:description: Separate filtering conditions using a semicolon. Conditions take values grammaticalFeatures and/or lexicalCategory and are case-sensitive. To list multiple values in single condition divide them with comma.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to return translations for a given word. In the event that a word in the dataset does not have a direct translation, the response will be a [definition](documentation/glossary?term=entry) in the target language.
Retrieve translation for a given word

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of all the valid filters to construct API calls.
Lists available filters

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of all the valid filters for a given endpoint to construct API calls.
Lists available filters for specific endpoint

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of the available [grammatical features](documentation/glossary?term=grammaticalfeatures) for a given language dataset.
Lists available grammatical features in a dataset

con:parameter.con:name: source_language
con:parameter.con:description: IANA language code. If provided output will be filtered by sourceLanguage.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to check if a word exists in the dictionary, or what 'root' form it links to (e.g., swimming > swim). The response tells you the possible [lemmas](documentation/glossary?term=lemma) for a given [inflected](documentation/glossary?term=inflection) word. This can then be combined with other endpoints to retrieve more information.
Check a word exists in the dictionary and retrieve its root form

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Retrieve available [lemmas](documentation/glossary?term=lemma) for a given [inflected](documentation/glossary?term=inflection) wordform. Filter results by categories.
Apply optional filters to Lemmatron response

con:parameter.con:name: filters
con:parameter.con:description: Separate filtering conditions using a semicolon. Conditions take values grammaticalFeatures and/or lexicalCategory and are case-sensitive. To list multiple values in single condition divide them with comma.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of monolingual and bilingual language datasets available in the API
Lists available dictionaries

con:parameter.con:name: sourceLanguage
con:parameter.con:description: IANA language code. If provided output will be filtered by sourceLanguage.

con:parameter.con:name: targetLanguage
con:parameter.con:description: IANA language code. If provided output will be filtered by sourceLanguage.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of available [lexical categories](documentation/glossary?term=lexicalcategory) for a given language dataset.
Lists available lexical categories in a dataset

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of the available [regions](documentation/glossary?term=regions) for a given monolingual language dataset.
Lists available regions in a monolingual dataset

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of the available [registers](documentation/glossary?term=registers) for a given monolingual language dataset.
Lists available registers in a monolingual dataset

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Returns a list of the available [registers](documentation/glossary?term=registers) for a given bilingual language dataset.
Lists available registers in a bilingual dataset

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to retrieve possible headword matches for a given string of text. The results are culculated using headword matching, fuzzy matching, and lemmatization
Retrieve possible matches to input

con:parameter.con:name: prefix
con:parameter.con:description: Set prefix to true if you'd like to get results only starting with search string.

con:parameter.con:name: regions
con:parameter.con:description: If searching in English, filter words with specific region(s) either 'us' or 'gb'.

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: Offset the start number of the result.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to find matches in our translation dictionaries.
Retrieve possible translation matches to input

con:parameter.con:name: prefix
con:parameter.con:description: Set prefix to true if you'd like to get results only starting with search string.

con:parameter.con:name: regions
con:parameter.con:description: Filter words with specific region(s) E.g., regions=us. For now gb, us are available for en language.

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: Offset the start number of the result.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to apply more complex filters to the list of words. For example, you may only want to filter out words for which all senses match the filter, or only its 'prime sense'. You can also filter by word length or match by substring (prefix).
Retrieve list of words for category with advanced options

con:parameter.con:name: filters_advanced
con:parameter.con:description: Semicolon separated list of wordlist parameters, presented as value pairs: LexicalCategory, domains, regions, registers. Parameters can take comma separated list of values. E.g., lexicalCategory=noun,adjective;domains=sport. Number of values limited to 5.

con:parameter.con:name: exclude
con:parameter.con:description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes headwords that have any senses in specified exclusion attributes (lexical categories, domains, etc.) from results.

con:parameter.con:name: exclude_senses
con:parameter.con:description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes only those senses of a particular headword that match specified exclusion attributes (lexical categories, domains, etc.) from results but includes the headword if it has other permitted senses.

con:parameter.con:name: exclude_prime_senses
con:parameter.con:description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes a headword only if the primary sense matches the specified exclusion attributes (registers, domains only).

con:parameter.con:name: word_length
con:parameter.con:description: Parameter to speficy the minimum (>), exact or maximum (<) length of the words required. E.g., >5 - more than 5 chars; <4 - less than 4 chars; >5<10 - from 5 to 10 chars; 3 - exactly 3 chars.

con:parameter.con:name: prefix
con:parameter.con:description: Filter words that start with prefix parameter

con:parameter.con:name: exact
con:parameter.con:description: If exact=true wordlist returns a list of entries that exactly matches the search string. Otherwise wordlist lists entries that start with prefix string.

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: Offset the start number of the result.

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description:
Use this to retrieve a list of words for particular [domain](documentation/glossary?term=domain), [lexical category](documentation/glossary?term=lexicalcategory), [register](documentation/glossary?term=registers) and/or [region](documentation/glossary?term=regions). View the full list of possible filters using the filters Utility endpoint. The response only includes headwords, not all their possible inflections. If you require a full wordlist including inflected forms, contact us and we can help.
Retrieve a list of words in a category

con:parameter.con:name: filters_basic
con:parameter.con:description: Semicolon separated list of wordlist parameters, presented as value pairs: LexicalCategory, domains, regions, registers. Parameters can take comma separated list of values. E.g., lexicalCategory=noun,adjective;domains=sport. Number of values limited to 5.

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: Offset the start number of the result
